meta.title: Okimoto House
meta.subject: Houses
Main streets
Yuba County History: Visual Archive
meta.description: Okimoto House, 7 D Street, Marysville, Calif. 1869. It is a two story brick home with front facing west. "A" frame roof, rectangular shape building. Two wood carved cornices supporting eaves at corners. Wooden carving between middle of eaves at the peak of roofline. Three double hung windows with arched frames on front side second story. Small front porch with balustrade of carved wood surrounding it on second floor. First floor has two double hung windows and door on south side. Transom above door. Three wooden squared poles supporting second floor porch. Approximatly three foot fence covered by ivy along front with many trees on south side.
meta.rights: unknown

meta.subject: Parades & processions
Yuba County History: Visual Archive
meta.description: Reputed to be the oldest continually held parade in California. The celebration is held on the second day of the second month of the Chinese lunar year

meta.title: Hanging of Ah Ben 1879
meta.subject: Hangings
Law enforcement
Homicides
Sheriffs
Ah Ben
Yuba County History: Visual Archive
meta.description: The hanging of Ah Ben, a Chinese immigrant, who murdered John McDaniel, owner of the Marysville Race Track, on the night of November 30, 1878. The hanging took place on Friday, March 14, 1879. Sheriff Hank L. McCoy appears on the right and Deputy Ike N. Aldrich on the left.

meta.title: Mama's Place
meta.subject: Restaurants
Buildings
Yuba County History: Visual Archive
meta.description: Mama's Place, Restaurant; 105 C Street, Marysville. Two story brick building (1855) connected to buildings on both sides, on north by one story building and on south by two sory. Commercial Italianate Venacular style noticed on top section and very similar to building on south side. Three windows on second floor front, one on north side. First floor has door in center with large display windows. Flanking it on south side is door leading to upstairs.

meta.title: Julia Morgan's Heffman House
meta.subject: Houses
Yuba County History: Visual Archive
meta.description: Heffman House, 725 F Street, Marysville, Calif.; built by Julia Morgan in the 1930s. This is an attractive two story stucco home. The portico which was built by the present owner has a broken pediment which echoes the broken pediment adorning the chimney. Doric columns support the roof of the portico. The window endremements are simple molding. The roof is jerkinhead with dormer windows. A plaque removed from the fireplace by the present owner which was presented to the original owner by Julia Morgan has been discarded.
meta.rights: unknown
